text: Alexander Münninghoff (13 April 1944 – 28 April 2020) was a Poland-born Dutch journalist and writer. From 1974 to 2007 he worked for the Haagsche Courant. Münninghoff wrote, among others, many articles and books about chess. In 1983 he won the and in 2015 he won the for his book De stamhouder. He died in The Hague where he lived, on 28 April 2020, aged 76. == References == Category:Dutch writers Category:Dutch journalists Category:1944 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Writers from Poznań Category:German emigrants to the Netherlands
title: Alexander Münninghoff
